title: Yurkov
author: Yurkov
content: Hi all,Recently, someone recommended me a fresh exchange from Hong Kong. Unfortunately, it's so new that I haven't been able to find much information about them. Maybe someone from Bitcointalk met with https://bitcorse.com/ and could say something about them?Ps. I know that we shouldn't use new, small and little-known exchanges, but I have my reasons for being interested in them.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Do you want to avoid scam? Do not use that fake exchange.If you need centralized exchanges, use this site to check their trustscore: https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchangesFor a decentralized exchange, use this site to check their trust score. Some are not that decentralized as the trustscore reduce: https://kycnot.me/

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMHi all,Recently, someone recommended me a fresh exchange from Hong Kong. Was it maybe someone you met online? I am asking because I honestly never heard about this exchange, and its a prety common scam tactic, scammers pretending that they are interested in person and slowly shifting conversations towards great opportunity to make money on some unknown exchange. Quote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMPs. I know that we shouldn't use new, small and little-known exchanges, but I have my reasons for being interested in them.I see that they are no listed on Coingecko and on CMC only as "untracked listing" which is not good sign at all. Being listed on those two sites doesn't of course mean that exchange is legit, but not being properly listed there is a huge red flag in my eyes and I would never deal with such exchanges.I just hope that if you decide to use it nevertheless, that you will send only small amounts that you are willing to loose.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Nothing information can be seen in bitcointalk regarding that site — cant it see on google. It doesn't have any live data on CMC and other similar price-tracking website as well. So i would rather avoid using such unknown site unless you want to get f*cked up.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on July 14, 2023, 01:40:56 PMI just hope that if you decide to use it nevertheless, that you will send only small amounts that you are willing to loose. He should not send money to that exchange at all, if he wants to avoid scam.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: I don't have an idea of this exchange and you know what everyone's thought if the exchange is new so, you've got the idea what to avoid.@OP, whatever your reasons are for trying them out. I urge you not to continue it if you're planning to deposit any amount there. Just by simply looking at the stats that they're bragging. Do you think that this is an honest volume?

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMHi all,Recently, someone recommended me a fresh exchange from Hong Kong. Why should you accept a small random exchange with no history recommended from someone, yet we have far much better reputable exchanges?I did some small digging, and it turns out that the person behind the exchange is even too lazy, and they just copied and pasted their terms of service from another exchange furxe.com which is now offline (archived terms of service) and they also copied the terms from Binance but forgot to edit out "Binance" in most parts of the terms  If that does not convince you that the exchange is up to no good intentions, then I don't know what will.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: A bit of research it point me to some links including CoinMarketCap currently Bitcorse exchange on CMC doesn't have data yet.And this exchange was mentioned on Binance and they do have a live introduction about the exchange and BCE token check the link below it looks like they are new and just published their project recently.- https://www.binance.com/sk/live/video?roomId=2138622It seems they are promoting their exchange and BCE token it looks legit but it is still new and another thing according to the video their token is still underdeveloped.For now, we can't say they are legit or scams but if you are going to use the exchange or buy their token just invest that you were willing to lose. Or better use a well-known exchange instead.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMHi all,Recently, someone recommended me a fresh exchange from Hong Kong. Unfortunately, it's so new that I haven't been able to find much information about them. Maybe someone from Bitcointalk met with https://bitcorse.com/ and could say something about them?Ps. I know that we shouldn't use new, small and little-known exchanges, but I have my reasons for being interested in them.Can you tell us what are these reasons? the exchange has zero reputation and is basically a cookie-cutter website, I can't think of anything that would make me wanna risk even 2 bucks.You mentioned someone recommending this to you. Do you personally know them? Are you sure it's not the typical scam DMs going around these days? For instance, see: Asian guy/girl from online dating mentors you to invest in Forex/Cryptocurrency Trading -- Sha Zhu Pan 杀猪盘 or Pig-Butchering Scam

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on July 14, 2023, 03:32:04 PMQuote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMHi all,Recently, someone recommended me a fresh exchange from Hong Kong. Why should you accept a small random exchange with no history recommended from someone, yet we have far much better reputable exchanges?I did some small digging, and it turns out that the person behind the exchange is even too lazy, and they just copied and pasted their terms of service from another exchange furxe.com which is now offline (archived terms of service) and they also copied the terms from Binance but forgot to edit out "Binance" in most parts of the terms  If that does not convince you that the exchange is up to no good intentions, then I don't know what will.Nice catch logfiles! It's not just that they copied the terms of service from furxe.com, but they didn't even bother to replace "FURXE" with their own name in several instances throughout the text. How lazy can you get?It's pretty obvious that their failure to pay attention to detail seriously calls into question their competence and reliability. Honestly, I wouldn't advise anyone to put their money in the hands of someone who shows such laziness and carelessness.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Are you, by any chance, part of the Bitcorse team? Or perhaps you want to help the exchange get noticed? Or paid to do it? I can't imagine how such an unknown exchange gets recommended. You've been around here for more than 10 years already. You were already here when Mt. Gox was still operating. You must already be aware how risky it is to deal with unknown and shady exchanges. And you can't even claim that the exchange is fresh or "so new." Even it's official Twitter account is already more than a year old. And if it is, it would be astonishing to know that its token has already more than $9 billion in volume with USDT.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: As you can see everyone here has not heard of bitcorse.com and of course no one will advise you to use any exchange if it is new and unknown such exchange.Perhaps your friend is trying to promote the exchange to get a commission via referral, or he is a member of the exchange team, so if your friend who advised you on this exchange is reliable, you can try it, but with a small deposit until you make sure of its credibility, but if it is not reliable, it is better to forget the idea And don't risk your money.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: Where have you been trading all this time? If it's on Binance, KuCoin, or some other major exchange, do you need to register at a casino you've never heard of? If I were you, I wouldn't try it. Even if I want to try it, maybe I'll register and just have a look at the features first before trying.This is the first time I've heard of that exchange. And what is the reason you are attracted to that exchange? Is it because it offers you something free that you want to try? You need to state why you are attracted to them so we can understand why you are asking for the exchange.Don't be too tempted by offers from new or small exchanges because we don't know the situation. It's better to be careful in choosing the exchange so that we don't experience fraud or scams.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMbut I have my reasons for being interested in them.Let me guess, that exchange will list the token in your signature? Yeah sure, carry on!  After all, both are equally useless, there is no significant worry.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Yurkov on July 14, 2023, 01:28:51 PMPs. I know that we shouldn't use new, small and little-known exchanges, but I have my reasons for being interested in them.So what is your deep and determined reason to use bitcorse.com exchange.....?I looked on in Coinmarketcap, there is no information about https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/bitcorse/, Volume data is untracked, honestly i will try not to use bitcorse.com exchange for a while, we don't know the risks that will be.We would at least know about the bitcorse.com exchange, if they were already registered with Coinmarketcap.For example like:Quote• Who Are the bitcorse Founders?• When Did bitcorse Launch?• Where Is bitcorse Located?• bitcorse Restricted Countries• What Coins Are Supported on bitcorse?• How Much Are bitcorse Fees?• Is It Possible To Use Leverage or Margin Trading on bitcorse?And so forth.Example: as we saw on the exchanges Binance, KuCoin and Kraken.1. https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/Binance/2. https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/KuCoin/3.https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/Kraken/My judgment is all that matters, as do the three exchanges above, but bitcorse isn't sure for me.for me do not, trust information about the exchange in other sources, except: Coinmarketcap.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on July 15, 2023, 02:37:00 PMfor me do not, trust information about the exchange in other sources, except: Coinmarketcap.LOL! I'm curious. Why would that be? Why would Coinmarketcap be the only source we should trust when Coinmarketcap itself is not trustworthy? Of the 621 Coinmarketcap reviews on Trustpilot, 83% of them gave the site 1 star out of 5. Overall, CMC averaged a very low 1.6 stars.  Had Bitcorse been listed on Coinmarketcap, would you trust it? Had Coinmarketcap indicated that Bitcorse has $9 billion in 24-hour volume, would you immediately believe it?What if Coinmarketcap registered Bitcorse but Coingecko, CoinLib, LiveCoinWatch, CoinCheckup, and others didn't?

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on July 15, 2023, 08:27:38 AMAs you can see everyone here has not heard of bitcorse.com and of course no one will advise you to use any exchange if it is new and unknown such exchange.Which is the right thing to do because when something online is already raising a red flag, better to stomp it out before it can become a big problem. OP mentioned that he has reasons to use the exchange, if he is transparent about his intentions, wouldn't he mind telling us the reason especially OP is asking about a review of the exchange that has no record on reputable websites?To OP, I don't know you and that exchange doesn't have any record here or any other sites that keep track of exchanges, but if you proceed to use the exchange even though a lot has already said that you shouldn't, that's on you.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on July 14, 2023, 01:43:58 PMNothing information can be seen in bitcointalk regarding that site — cant it see on google. It doesn't have any live data on CMC and other similar price-tracking website as well. Everyone must have their own beginning and a period when they are completely anonymous. I also remember when Binance was in such a position. Being a beginner does not have to be an argument that it is a scam.Unfortunately, many new businesses think that they should not present themselves here on the forum, it seems to me that the potential of the bitcointalk forum for further development is being lightly neglected. I miss those days when this place was the starting point for crypto businesses.For this site that the OP mentioned, exchange or whatever it represents, it is more than obvious that it is a scam, I even think that the OP is the owner of it. It is enough for me to see the "About us" section on the site, where there is only a "staking" page??? to know that it is a cheap attempt at fraud. Although more than enough evidence has already been presented on this topic by other members.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.created_time: July 16, 2023, 03:19:21 PMLast edit: July 16, 2023, 04:38:36 PM by Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on July 15, 2023, 02:37:00 PMfor me do not, trust information about the exchange in other sources, except: Coinmarketcap.Exchange being listed on Coinmarketcap is no sign of legitimacy at all. After all, they are not even best at what they do (imho that's Coingecko). Quote from: examplens on July 16, 2023, 02:43:12 PMFor this site that the OP mentioned, exchange or whatever it represents, it is more than obvious that it is a scam, I even think that the OP is the owner of it. It is enough for me to see the "About us" section on the site, where there is only a "staking" page??? to know that it is a cheap attempt at fraud. Although more than enough evidence has already been presented on this topic by other members.If you check OP's post history you will see that he is doing altcoin bounty campaigns and I seriously doubt that someone who owns dodgy exchange would bother with bounty campaigns that usually bring peanuts. More plausible scenario is that some altcoin that he got via bounty campaign got listed on Bitcorse, or maybe he wants to buy some shitcoin that is only available there.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Darker45 on July 16, 2023, 03:23:57 AMWhat if Coinmarketcap registered Bitcorse but Coingecko, CoinLib, LiveCoinWatch, CoinCheckup, and others didn't?That's a different story, you can say it depends on the individual, isn't it, the assessment is in each of us, You believe (Coingecko, CoinLib, LiveCoinWatch, CoinCheckup) and I believe Coinmarketcap, isn't that black and blonde hair the same for everyone and definitely different thoughts.Bottom line: bitcorse exchange is registered with any of them or all of them Coinmarketcap, Coingecko, CoinLib, LiveCoinWatch, CoinCheckup, otherwise there would be no consideration for me using bitcorse, even on Coinmarketcap. are we now able to laugh out loud.I should have said Coinmarketcap as an example, I shouldn't have said 'unless' but not guidelines on Coinmarketcap, others are also considered.Quote from: Rikafip on July 16, 2023, 03:19:21 PMExchange being listed on Coinmarketcap is no sign of legitimacy at all. After all, they are not even best at what they do (imho that's Coingecko). Maybe I should use the word 'Example' instead of 'except'It seems like: https://Coingecko.com/exchanges/bitcorse/, say even worse.QuoteUh oh...I think we're lost.I reverified on bitcorse, guidelines on Coingecko, Coinmarketcap, CoinLib, LiveCoinWatch, CoinCheckup etc. According to their respective beliefs, if bitcorse is not registered there do not use it, it may be risky to carry out activities.
